metadata.Title: CVE-2020-3481 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: A vulnerability in the EGG archive parsing module in Clam AntiVirus (ClamAV) Software versions 0.102.0 - 0.102.3 could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service condition on an affected device. The vulnerability is due to a null pointer dereference. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted EGG file to an affected device. An exploit could allow the attacker to cause the ClamAV scanning process crash, resulting in a denial of service condition.

criterions.comment: clamav: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
